channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DOJ arrests three people in connection with Minneapolis church protests
item.description: The DOJ has arrested at least two people in connection with protests at a Minneapolis church last weekend. One of the pastors is said to lead the local ICE field office.
item.content:encoded: The DOJ has arrested at least two people in connection with protests at a Minneapolis church last weekend. One of the pastors is said to lead the local ICE field office.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: A look back at Ruby Ridge â€” and why it's relevant today in Minnesota
item.description: More than 30 years ago, a standoff with a white separatist family in Idaho led to federal rules on deadly use of force. Some say Renee Macklin Good's death in Minnesota offers a similar opportunity.
item.content:encoded: More than 30 years ago, a standoff with a white separatist family in Idaho led to federal rules on deadly use of force. Some say Renee Macklin Good's death in Minnesota offers a similar opportunity.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Last year was disaster for an HIV vaccine trial. This year? A new way forward
item.description: A cutting edge pan-African HIV vaccine trial lost funding last year when the Trump administration shut down much of foreign aid. The setback was devastating but the researchers refused to give up.
item.content:encoded: A cutting edge pan-African HIV vaccine trial lost funding last year when the Trump administration shut down much of foreign aid. The setback was devastating but the researchers refused to give up.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Pentagon vows to end 'woke distractions' at military's independent newspaper
item.description: The editor-in-chief of Stars and Stripes responds to a Defense Department announcement that it will assume greater control over the military newspaper.
item.content:encoded: The editor-in-chief of Stars and Stripes responds to a Defense Department announcement that it will assume greater control over the military newspaper.
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: Winter storm preparations underway across the South
item.description: Across the South and Northeast, communities are preparing for snow and ice from a massive winter storm expected to move through this weekend.
item.content:encoded: Across the South and Northeast, communities are preparing for snow and ice from a massive winter storm expected to move through this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Justin Hicks

item.title: The week in science: Ice, parents' disgust and penguins adapting to climate change
item.description: Emily Kwong and Regina Barber of NPR's Short Wave podcast talk about the mysterious structure of ice, parents' heightened tolerance for disgust, and how penguins are adapting to climate change.
item.content:encoded: Emily Kwong and Regina Barber of NPR's Short Wave podcast talk about the mysterious structure of ice, parents' heightened tolerance for disgust, and how penguins are adapting to climate change.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: What Pennsylvania swing voters think of Trump's first year back in office
item.description: How do Biden-to-Trump voters feel about year one of Trump's second term? A focus group of Pennsylvania voters provides some unique insight.
item.content:encoded: How do Biden-to-Trump voters feel about year one of Trump's second term? A focus group of Pennsylvania voters provides some unique insight.
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: How to prepare your home for a winter storm
item.description: This weekend, much of the country is expecting to be hit by a major winter storm. NPR's Life Kit share tips to prepare your home ahead of a big snowfall.
item.content:encoded: This weekend, much of the country is expecting to be hit by a major winter storm. NPR's Life Kit share tips to prepare your home ahead of a big snowfall.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Death of a detainee at an ICE detention center in Texas is ruled a homicide
item.description: The El Paso County medical examiner classified the death of a 55-year-old Cuban ICE detainee as homicide.
item.content:encoded: The El Paso County medical examiner classified the death of a 55-year-old Cuban ICE detainee as homicide.
item.dc:creator: Angela Kocherga

item.title: Greenland and the world order
item.description: Is there a deal between the U.S., Denmark and Greenland? Mary Louise Kelly and the team on NPR's national security podcast break it down.
item.content:encoded: Is there a deal between the U.S., Denmark and Greenland? Mary Louise Kelly and the team on NPR's national security podcast break it down.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly
